description: I can see why this place has been around since the 60s - the place is straight and to the point. Lots of familiar food options, simple and delicious, and the staff is friendly. I can see this place getting busy during lunch time, as we went in for a late breakfast, and the line started to grow. I got the regular breakfast burrito (eggs, cheese, sausage) which hit the spot, and my dad ordered the 2 egg breakfast. Delish diner food and some of the best home fries my Dad has ever eaten (his words)! Be ready to add a lot of creamer to your drip coffee - the brewed coffee was bit harsh and very bitter.
author: Jessica S.

description: Busy during lunch hours, convenient from where I work.  There were no places to sit, long lines. Ordered the turkey, avocado, swiss on dutch.  There was literally nothing special about it! Nothing.  The bread was so hard and stale.  It tasted like a plain sandwich with mayo and mustard.  I'm not sure why this place gets high ratings.  It's definitely not from their turkey sandwich.
author: KB B.

description: I got charged $3 for this MIERDA! The cashier that wears the chef coat is a JOKE. He overcharges too. I wouldn't doubt it if they spit or do other gross things into people's food. There's just some shade going in there. BOLO!
author: Connie C.

description:
Chicken posole and grilled cheese on sourdough. 

Soup not too spicy - cause I dont do spice at all.  But was pleasantly surprised!  Sandwich was good. Quaint little spot on the corner. 
Will definitely be back again! 

Ate a late lunch.
author: Solo S.

description: Best tortilla soup in the city. Only on certain days, like wed/thurs. Call to be sure.. it is a little  on the pricier side... but if u need tortilla soup fix... u must go here.
author: Jose J.

description: Amazing pancakes and amazing mapple syrup to go with them. This place id heaven, plain and simple. If it was a bit cleaner I would not doubt to give them 5 stars. For now, 4.5 seems enough.
author: Charles G.

description: Great place for lunch on workdays. Friendly staff and good food. I come here 2-4 times a week. Food quality is always good. It's a casual place, it's not fancy and it doesn't try to be. When I took my friend he ordered a burrito and was not pleased with it, and I was like dude.... it's a deli they make white people food. He was like but all the people making the food aren't white I thought they knew how to make a burrito and finally he admitted when something is listed as 'mexican delights' that section might not be the most legit for ordering. I generally order the special or on occasion get a cheeseburger. Most important they have coke machine with CHERRY COKE.
author: A Girl Has N.

description:
Dang--that was a GOOD breakfast burrito! All fresh ingredients and all tasty. Seriously, this shouldn't be hard, and yet, most places do breakfast burritos a dis-service. Nice job nailing it, Pete's!

However, it was over seven dollars for a pretty small burrito. I am fine paying seven dollars and I'm fine with a small burrito but both don't quite feel right. If you've ever bought a baby burrito somewhere, that's about the size you can expect from this one. But if it keeps you in business, play on, playa!
author: Mario T.

description:
Meh.  That sums up Pete's for me.  Was at the hospital across the street so came here for a couple of quick sandwiches.   Wit in line to order.  There's one guy that takes orders, hands you a ticket.  Then you go wait in line at the register.  Same guy who took your order comes to the register and takes your money.  Why dont you just take my money when I order?

Wait for the sandwiches.  Not crowded so WTF are you guys doing.  Finally get my sandwiches and they're just average.  Unremarkable in every way.  But after not eating for 8 hours my hunger is satisfied.  Next time will look for another place.
author: Steve G.

description: Mom and Pop shop! Great food all around. We had the burger, and two different sandwiches and we were not disappointed.
author: Natalie A.

description: Conveniently located across from Mt Zion where I spend all too much time. They have breakfast sandwiches, typical egg/potato breakfasts and regular sandwiches. Service is pretty fast and friendly. Wish there were more plant based options. The potatoes are pretty good. Prices are reasonable.
author: Marco M.

description:
This is a review of the (non) service provided by the heavy set man (HSM) that has worked here for ages. I had stopped patronizing this deli because this man would ignore me; I asked a male co-worker to come with me to see if things changed in regards to service, sure enough things were different and the HSM suddenly acknowledged me. Crappy, huh? I gave the HSM the benefit of the doubt and started going here on my own and things were ok. HSM never smiles, but whatever I was being acknowledged. Today, I go in to replay my winning lotto ticket, he says "Winning ticket?" Me: "Yes." I place it on the counter, he's counting dollar bills out of the tip jar, and counting, and counting, and taking more out and counting. I'm thinking "you've got to be kidding me, HSM!" One of the cooks comes over and hands him a wrapped sandwich: lemon chicken. He takes the sandwich and for the next 30 seconds tries to get the attention of a woman by the door ignoring HIM! Payback I guess, but it doesn't satisfy me because I'm not dishing it out - grrr. So I say "She's obviously ignoring you, can you help me?" But he doesn't. She finally looks up and says, "No, I ordered a  burger." So I figure, ok HSM is going to help me now...but he doesn't. He starts putting the lemon chicken in a bag very slowly, selecting a napkin very slowy...and at that point I just can't anymore, so I slam my hand on the counter and grab my lotto ticket and leave. You know? If you don't want my business, guess what? Success! I'm not stepping foot in your deli ever again and I will tell as many of my UCSF co-workers to boycott you as well, you rude Heavy Set Man!
PS: I went to the store on the corner of Sutter and Pierce got my lotto tickets and some baklava!
author: yoshi w.

description: I'm not one to write a bad review & normally I get over a bad service I get if it's my first time at the restaurant. But the past few times I've been here has been shitty service. This morning I ordered through Eat 24 while I was on the way to work @ 6:45am. Through the app, Pete's has a pre-order system so I said to myself "why not" & ordered myself some breakfast because I, & a lot of other people, don't have the time to make myself some in the morning. So I get a text from eat 24 saying that they open at 7am so give them 15-30 mins to prep my food. I was completely okay with it. I head out of my department to get some coffee first then head to Pete's so I can get there around 7:30am. The moment the man working the cashier gets to me, he tries to give me shit for ordering at 6:45am when they have a pre-order system set through Eat 24. He tells me "so just to let you know that we open at 7am". I'm like yeah I know that obviously. Then says "if I get a call at 6:30 in the morning from yelp, I am not going to answer it." "So remember, we open at 7am." Like oh fucking kay, I don't care at this point on what you tell me. Just give me my food because I obviously see that your staff has already made it & I came at the right time to pick it up too. If you don't want your customers to make pre-orders on your Eat 24, CHANGE YOUR FUCKING SYSTEM. Don't blame the customer for putting in an order so early because you LET them.
author: Rebekahruth Y.

description: Love this place! Great food, and Pete is really nice. Quick and easy, specials are always good, default sandwich shop in the neighborhood. More than just sandwiches too!
author: Julian S.

description: We are vegan! And we had wonderfull vegan food here. Eggplant and hummus sandwich and middle eastern salad plate. It was delicious and inexpensive! Tasty food, with fantastic service! Highly recommend Pete's!
author: Lane L.

description: In the neighborhood, so dropped by for lunch. The food is your standard, unpretentious American lunch fixins. The menu is fairly extensive with lots of burger, sandwich, brunch options. The staff are nice and food came out super quickly which is a plus. I got a chicken caesar salad which was sizeable and tasty, but nothing remarkable. Chicken was warm and juicy, salad was not overdressed and cheese was mixed in or not distinguishable from dressing. Came with a few slices of buttery garlic toast instead of croutons which I can get behind. It's kind of pricey for what you get. For good service, solid quality, fast food this is a great spot!
author: Truc N.

description:
CASH ONLY.

Recommendations:

OMG they have POZOLE.
TORTILLA SOUP.
Chicken noodle is great too!
Little yogurts and snacks and candy.
But seriously, cold days in SF (which is like all the time) - GET THE SOUP - it's homemade.
BLT -- taste like heaven.
Grilled cheese and a small soup DEAL!
Entree items - meat is cut to perfection.

Love the manager Jose too. Talk to him, he remembers your order. Friendly guy.
author: Nicole N.

description: The cook was a nice guy: He gave me some pastrami to try out. But the sandwich I ordered was awful. The Dutch crunch bread was stale. The meat portion was skimpy. Overall taste of sandwich was completely underwhelming. Would never go here again (thanks to places like Little Luccas in the Bay Area).
author: Samuel M.

description: My favorite sandwich here is the turkey, avocado, and swiss on dutch crunch. I've been working in the area for a few years. That sandwich pretty much does it for me and they're consistent every time. I come here when I can although I usually pack my lunch. The staff is nice and you get your food in a reasonable amount of time. This place is cash only, so come prepared! However, there is an ATM right outside of this sandwich shop.
author: Ruby V.

description: Breakfast bagel was mediocre - very very thin strip of egg and an American cheese overload on a not very good bagel. Way too expensive ($4.99) for what you get and for such a dive - there are far better breakfast sandwiches to be had all over the city. Also, it's 2016 and they're cash only - what gives? It's not like their prices are any lower for being cash-only
author: Farhad M.

description: Bomb a$$ chorizo breakfast burrito.  Good neighborhood spot for a bite, also sell lotto, two birds one stone
author: Ralph M.

description: Super friendly, all their food I've had is high quality and made with love. Especially good burgers! There's also an ATM right outside if you don't have cash.
author: Ari O.

description:
Pete's had a short line waiting for food. no time to wait. meter ticking.

menu: salads, sammies, hummus, breakfast, burgers,  special of the day. etc. 

brew: cafe romano (m 2)
-smooth, semirobust,  no harshness

drips:
-quick ring up....self service coffee.
author: Victor G.

description:
Delicious chicken pesto sandwich! I asked if I could substitute sourdough bread for the ciabbata - no problem. Hated asking during the busy lunch hour, but I don't like thick bread on a sandwich. The pesto was wonderful! Plus, lots of all-white meat. Very crowded, as it was 12 sharp, but that's when my husband's procedure at nearby UCSF campus had ended, and he had to stay there for awhile. One of the staff recommended it. TG I'd brought cash.
   Seating was jammed, so I politely asked another woman if she'd mind if I shared her table. TG, not a problem. 
   I looked around at others' lunches, and they all looked great!
author: Mara B.

description: best cheeseburgers in the city, by far,  french fries are good also.  pleasant people working there.    Nice place for lunch.
author: Charlie W.

description:
This place makes amazing sandwiches! Good meal for a great price. If you need something fast,
I would recommend going here.
author: David F.

description: Great cheese steak sandwich lots of onions and peppers also had the Mediterranean plate all very fresh. Will definitely return for more
author: Paul S.

description: First time in this place, staff was patient with us taking a bit to decide what we wanted, also gave helpful suggestions. Food was very tasty.
author: Sheboan R.

description:
If I were working at UCSF hospital or an ailing patient making an attempt to sneak out of my room, I would definitely skip the hospital's cafeteria and walk across the street to this corner Divisadero Deli. 

I had a late lunch here after my project was done at the hospital. I heard this cornered deli could get extremely busy during operation hours, which means the deli is popular. 

For my late lunch, I had the Pulled Pork sandwich. For $6.99, the sandwich has grilled pork meat with a drench of Barbecue sauce in a toasted roll. There are no combo meals here. So I ordered a side of fries and can of Root beer. The deli's Pulled Pork may not compete in many Barbecue places, nevertheless a solid meal.  

As I was enjoying my lunch, workers from the hospital were in and out of the deli picking up meals. Joe Cool enjoyed looking at the nurses with my meal. 

One of my colleagues told me the Pesto Chicken sandwich is also good and a popular sandwich too. I may try that soon. 

The deli only accepts cash.
author: Matt G.

description: Highly disappointed !!! So I decided to try this place out since it has like 4 stars on Yelp. Went in, ordered two sandwiches, a salami sandwich and a ham and turkey one. First off, it was 3 people in that line, I was the first one so my sandwich should have been made first, but instead they made the other two customers first because it seemed like they knew them. Anyways, got my sandwich and bread turned out hella hard, nobody wants to eat a hard ass sandwich... Not very tasty at all. When I thought things couldn't get worse... Found a goddamn bug in my sandwich! Never again, not for me thanks.
author: Lily S.

description:
I did a double take when I saw the name. Peet's vs Pete's. Anyway that confusion did not last too long. This is a long way from Peet's. This is neighborhood diner right across from UCSF. It is small, pretty bare and serve breakfast, sandwiches, coffee etc.

It was pretty busy and I am sure they get a lot of traffic from UCSF. It would have been a higher rating except that they messed up my order. Wrong type of bread and wrong fillings in my omelet. 

Note - they don't accept CC, you need those greenbacks.
author: Sunil R.

description: Great food, good prices, and very friendly staff.  What more could you ask for when looking for a quick lunch. This deli has definitely been added to my list of go to  lunch spots.  I work all over San Francisco and am glad to have somewhere to eat when Im on this side of town.
author: Eric C.

description: I absolutely love this place. It oozes charm. My girlfriend and I came here while on vacation. Originally we chose a breakfast place down the road but they closed early due to plumbing issues. Walking back to our car we saw a sign for this place and stopped by. If you're in the area stop over here and treat yo self.
author: James L.

description: Hands down the best grilled ham and cheese sandwich on sliced sourdough that I have ever had. Such a simple sandwich yet so good. Don't be plain, get it with everything on it.
author: Michelle L.

description: My meeting at Mt. Zion was cancelled, so I decided to grab some lunch to go since food at the cafeteria at work can get a bit...tired and unappealing.  Since this was right across the street from my shuttle stop, I decided to go here.  There was lots of choices on the menu, made to order breakfast, burgers and hot items.  I decided on the Turkey, Avocado and Swiss on Dutch Crunch.  The bread was soft, not hard.  And the sandwich was good, but basic.  I'm used to having garlic spread which they don't provide here.  But, none the less.  It was a good sandwich.  If ever I need to go down to Divisadero again, I'll try some of the other items on the menu.
author: Marjorie G.

description: Came here for breakfast and lunch many times given close proximity to work. Food is ok but they are SKIMPY on the portion size and pricier than their local competitor on the same block. Ordered a chicken pesto sandwich for lunch that was tasty but the slice of chicken inside was nearly invisible. Breakfast sandwich/burrito were very plain, also skimpy in size.
author: Patrick A.

description: I like the god flavor and the good condiments that they use for all specific sandwiches they make every day  for example torta cubana bbq pork chiken blt, pulled pork and they are continu making egg salad sandwich
author: Jose G.

description: Great place to grab lunch. They have alot to choose from. I'm on a bland diet so a turkey sandwich was perfect for me. My husband got a BBQ chicken sandwich he said it was good. Service is fast! Small place but great for a quick bite. I love fast service
author: Melissa J.

description:
Busy, fast, and good. 

I had a moment to grab some food after my appointment and popped in because it smelled good and it seemed busy. I used my time in line to go over the menu on the wall -  sandwiches, salads, breakfast, and other stuff- and settled on a hot turkey sandwich and a lemon bar. 

After paying and waiting a few minutes, my order was ready and I left with a sandwich teeming with chunks of hot turkey. The lemon bar was equally delicious. My only regret was that I didn't get the fries.

If you like to eat food, you'll love to eat it from here.
author: Loli L.

description:
We (4 people) were in the area due to a visit to Mount Zion hospital. We had two meals in the same day. Sadly, both times we had problems. 

For breakfast they served us cool and undercooked potatoes with our eggs. Three of the four didn't turn back the potatoes but didn't eat them. The fourth person told the cook and he rolled is eyes and gave us a new plate. Unfortunately they weren't much warmer or cooked. 

We paid for a side order of avocado but never received. 

For our lunch they got one burrito order incorrect. But they did correct it after we let them know. 

The two burgers had stale buns and very dry. 

The fourth meal was a pulled pork sandwich which was good. 

Though the staff seemed nice enough the food is very inconsistent. There are not a lot of restaurant choices in the area but we will attempt to find another place located near the hospital.
author: L L.

description: My sister and I stopped here for breakfast before her doctor's appointment at Mt. Zion. She had the chorizo super breakfast burrito and I had a chicken pesto sandwich. Since it was our first time there, the staff was super friendly and attentive. They were more than happy to give us recommendations. Both of our meals were extremely delicious. The ambiance was very basic but clean. I'm giving this place 4 stars only because they don't take credit/debit.
author: Andrea G.

description: A range of standard sandwiches and special ones like muffaletta. I haven't tried their hamburgers. You wait at the table and they bring it to you (listen for your order number).  Not everything is available daily, but the posted specials on paper signs usually are but just ask the staff.
author: Dan C.

description: Look's like Pete's is gauging their customers on sales tax.  My bill for a pastrami sandwich and coffee was $9.24. I was charged sales tax of $0.90 which makes the sales tax rate 9.7%.  The sales tax in San Francisco County is 8.75%. The pastrami sandwich had a thin slice of pastrami and the rye bread was toasted but the toast was cold.
author: Marc P.

description:
Stopped by for a quick sandwich and was pleasantly surprised to find a full menu with lots of unexpected offerings. You can find pretty much any type of lunch you're looking for (hot sandwich, cold sandwich, burrito, breakfast, chicken, special of the day, etc...) and everything looked good from what I could tell from creepily looking at other people's plates.

+ prices were good ($6.50 for a huge sandwich I made into two meals)
+ wide variety
+ healthy options 
+ giant cooler with gas station level of variety
- cash only
- confusing to order if you've never been there

I got the turkey, avacado and swiss on dutch crunch and WOWZA make sure to get the dutch crunch. It was DELICIOUS. Half of my sandwich and I was more than satisfied so I kept the other half for later (I'm currently eating it). When reheating dutch crunch, just put it in the toaster oven for a couple minutes and it is seriously ALMOST better than the first time around. 

I will definitely return here for lunch... I can't promise I won't order the same again and again though. SO GOOD!
author: Jane B.

description:
The sandwiches and the hot entrees are wonderful! I usually get the turkey cranberry sandwich because it reminds me of my favorite holiday. 
The only downside: 
they only take cash
author: Kim E.

description:
This place is definitely one of the better lunch venues around the area. As a UCSF employee, I try to venture as far away as possible from hospital food..though a busy schedule, carrying only cards, and desperation to only seek sustenance to keep me going can bring me back to the cafeteria. =P 

BUT! If I DO have cash on me (Pete's doesn't take card) and am craving a sandwich I'd head on over to this little deli shop. Large selection of sandwiches (catered to both meat and non-meat lovers), bottled drinks, and random hot foods (ie. mac & cheese, fried chicken, etc). Service is great! The guys behind the counter are friendly and the food comes out within minutes of ordering.

Warning: this place gets PACKED between 12-1pm on the weekdays.

Food: I've only tried the BBQ chicken on a dutch crunch roll ($6.99) & Chicken pesto on a ciabatta roll ($6.89). A nice sized meal...So filling!! Although the dutch crunch here is pretty hard and feels like it can cut your mouth. I've had better (try Lou's café in the Richmond district). 

Overall: 4. If you're in the area, want a simple sandwich, and have some cash on you. Go for it!
author: Loriel L.

description:
3.65 stars... Cash only! Who does that in the 21st century? Get a card machine! Quit being cheap and pay the 3%. Now all I'm going to remember is oh I can't go there as I never have cash on me. 

My sandwich was good though, I got the peppered turkey, cranberry and cheese sandwich. 

They have more grilled sandwiches than not so if you like that sort of thing. Also, they have a very diverse menu so there is much to try if you have cash.... Burgers, cheesesteak, vegetarian, Mexican, salad, breakfast, fries, pasta salad
author: Renee S.

description:
Big sandwiches. Cheap. Get the roasted turkey (house special #1) on sourdough roll. It's a mix of light and dark meats, and the turkey is roasted in-house.

Not sure what the deal is with all these Yelpers complaining about rudeness. I walked up to the counter, ordered my sandwich, paid for it, and ate it. How someone could possibly find themselves in an altercation with the help is beyond me.
author: Uli Z.

description: I don't know why I've never reviewed Pete's before, I eat here ALL THE TIME!  Why?  #1 it's walking distance from the job & #2 I have never been dis-satisfied!  I can't tell you of a single item that I haven't thoroughly enjoyed! My favorite "go to" is the chicken pesto on a sourdough roll.  I'm salivating just typing that!  Oh, and you think the cheesesteak place across the street is the bomb? PPPPSSHHHHTTTT!!!!  Pete's cheesesteak sandwiches are 100 Xs better!!  If you go, bring cash, as they don't accept cards (there's an ATM right outside).  Oh, and ask for a "Frequent Eater" card - get 12 stamps and your 13th meal is free!  Say "Hi!" To Javier at the register and give him a hard time.  He's a riot!
author: Kathy H.

description:
I come here occasionally at lunch when I want a turkey burger.
Today I think is my last visit.  Tho I think the burger was fine, simple, I like simple, 
but I paid for their "special" turkey burger which is $7.99...all other burgers are $6.49ish.  I didn't want the cheese or the mushrooms, which make it "special", I just wanted a plain turkey burger.  When I asked about it I was dismissed with "we have one price for the turkey burger".  I just thought it was a poor choice on their part, clearly I wasn't getting the special but was charged as if I were.  These kind of things can be adjusted...this is a small deli...they have the power to change the price...lost a long time customer for just over a buck.
author: Hip P.

description:
BREAKFAST review

Pros:
- egg bagel sandwich (inexpensive and delicious!)
- friendly employees
- quick service
- conveniently located next to UCSF Mt Zion

Cons:
- cash only
- coffee is kept in a giant carafe that just sits there all day

Bottom line: I loved this place because it was just down the block where I lived. It's a solid choice, if you're in the area, but don't go out of your way just to eat here.
author: Jiann M.

description: I stopped by here today after a medical appointment and brought a Philly cheese steak from here. It was great. I love how the steak and cheese melt together perfectly along with the peppers. This is my second time eating here. I love how they wrap it in foil so it was still warm when I returned to work to eat it. I highly recommend this as a great lunch spot in the City.
author: Kiana D.

description:
Wandered in before an evening class at UCSF.  As a result of the time, we happened to see their closing procedures.  Let me tell you, the place may not look brand new or fancy in any way, but it is CLEAN.  They were going to town on the grill!  I would eat there again any time.

Hubby had the club, which he was very happy with, and I had the falafel plate, which I have to say was really unusually tasty.  The falafel has something different (in a good way) about it - extra sesame?  I don't know, but it was really fresh, the tabbuleh had everything in the right proportions, and the hummos wasn't overly garlicky.

Also, I know how annoying it is when someone walks in 15 minutes before closing but they were very gracious about it and really went above and beyond - my falafel was extremely crispy (to be honest, I was expecting it to be pre-done, but it was hot and fresh) and they toasted my husband's club to perfection.

Recommended!
author: Amy L.

description: Sandwiches are delicious with fresh ingredients and reasonable price. The staff was very polite and helpful. Our food was ready quickly. Great experience eating here. Only thing to watch out for is that it's cash only.
author: Rhonda J.

description: I came here and got a BLT and it was not bad but for what I paid, I expected that  it would at least have a bit more bacon on it. It was not bad but I did not know there was mayo on my sandwich so I was not all that happy about it.
author: Angela S.

description:
The fact that I'm doing this posting should tell you how angry I am.  Went there for the first time today based on a friend's recommendation and the fact I have to be at Mt. Zion everyday for the next month.

Decent sandwich.  Sandwich guys incredibly unfriendly, wear gloves for what reason I don't know because they take them on and off, wipe their brows, etc..., and most incredulously, the jerk who handles the cash accuses me of trying to shoplift two $8 sandwiches.  

I place my order for two sandwiches at the order counter, then go pay this jerk.  He gives me my receipt, then my $4.03 change and then I go back and wait.  My meter was running so I was in a hurry.  I then get the sandwiches and ask for a bag, and then he asks me if I paid for them then I replied, "Yes, you took my $20".   He gives me the bag, and as I walk out he calls me back and says I never paid for them.

Knowing my meter was running I said, "If I have $4.03 in my pocket with a receipt, you owe me an apology, plus you should give me the sandwiches free."  People were watching and not only was it embarassing, I pulled out the receipt and the $4.03 chane (he gave me).  He then muttered something and then I literally had to run.

Absolutely brutal service and a shame to treat customers like this.  If you're the owner and reading this, you need to talk to this jerk.
author: Robert C.

description:
Pete's Deli is growing on me, I guess.  Most of their food is just about average and their prices are a little on the high side considering there's really nothing special or gourmet about their food.  They are really popular at lunch time and the place is pretty crowded most of the time.  I guess it's because their customers like the fact that the service is fast and friendly.    

So far, I've tried the following items: 

Turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce: Turkey is cold.  The soft roll is blah. There's not much on the sandwich but the cranberry sauce.  Not worth the price.  

Breakfast burritos and breakfast sandwiches:  These are pretty good.  You get your sandwich or burrito piping hot.  For both, you get your choice of ham, bacon or sausage and it comes with egg and cheese.  If you get the "special breakfast burrito" it comes with hashbrowned potatoes and salsa too, for about a dollar extra.  I think the sandwiches are more worth the price because the burritos are pretty small whether or not you get the regular or the special.

Mediterranean Plate: Comes with hummus, tabouleh, two medium size falafel, diced cucumber and tomatoes and a pita sliced into 4 wedges.  The taste of everything was fairly well seasoned and fresh.  I would say that this plate is worth the price (around $6 or $7) and is a good option for when you feel like having a light or vegetarian lunch.
author: Danielle O.

description:
My go-to deli! the service is always good, no matter how busy it can get. The food is delicious. I always get the turkey, avocado, and Swiss.

Taking off a star because it's cash only, and the mocha is a bit bitter for my taste.
author: YJ K.

description:
The big sign hanging outside said that Pete's has been serving "The best food in San Francisco" since 1969, so I figured it couldn't be too bad.

I saw a lot of yummy looking sandwiches, but since I'm not often awake at 9am (at least in the summer), I wanted to take advantage of the breakfast food. I ordered a Breakfast Burrito Supreme, a tortilla stuffed with eggs, cheese, steak (there are other meat options too), potatoes, and salsa. Here it is: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/e3d-jYxVx7YLTxQ2CEmb0g?select=Of7YUtiIVzOoSFNaDRZMFQ.

My burrito really could have used more steak--I could barely taste but, though overall, it was delicious, especially dipped in a little bit of that red sauce. As for "the best food in San Francisco?" That's a bit of a hefty claim.
author: K W.

description:
People.  People.

This is not a four-star SF sandwich joint.  The food is overpriced by about 30%, the sandwich bread always is overbuttered and overburnt.

Food is too expensive and mediocre not to take credit cards.

The coffee sucks.  The line is long only b/c UC is right next door and all the clinically depressed physicians line up in Bartleby-esque fashion for lunch while telling themselves they are living it up in the SFBay.

They're not.
author: Carun J.

description: I work close by and my coworkers and I usually come here a few times a week. They have such a wide variety and everything is delicious! I prefer the eggplant sandwhich and boca burger mmmmmmm :)
author: Amber D.

description:
Cash only. 
Was expecting the bagels to be better.. But they were just alright. 

Good prices. Fast. Lots of breakfast/lunch options. 

May come back to try a sandwich but will choose cafe murano's breakfast bagel a few blocks up over the one here..
author: Shanna N.

description:
Got a "Sleeping Pill" specialty burger today which was delicious and a bit too filling for one sitting.

For the price, the burger was enormous and pretty tasty. It's no Umami Burger, but definitely a decent lunch place if you're in the area and need a quick bite.
author: Skippy T.

description: Classic classic spot with lots of good simple food to choose from. The staff is awesome, fun and friendly. ....im definitely coming back
author: Virginia V.

description:
I came here for the first time and had the hot roast turkey sandwich. It was very delicious; I might even go as far to say it the best sub I've had since moving to SF.

I read through some reviews while waiting for my sandwich and many of them mentioned that this place is overpriced. I wanted to address this because I am very sensitive to price/value when I eat out. I must say that Pete's is definitely on the high end as far as value goes. My 7" sandwich was under $7 and my can of soda was $1. Good luck finding soda for under $1 in SF! And at $7 my sandwich was a great value as it was delicious and very filling.

The only negative is that they're cash only.
author: Andrew M.

description: Huge portions. I got the BBQ Chicken sandwich and it was solid. I'll give it a 4 star rating for the size, and a 3.5 for the taste. I'd try another sandwich next time, itll probably give me better results as most deli's aren't know for their BBQ sanwiches
author: Nikko J.

description:
Chicken barley soup and grilled cheese. YUM

FYI... CASH ONLY!
author: Monette P.

description: Awesome sandwich shop, and this is coming from an East Coast transplant who knows a thing or two about deli sandwiches. This is as close as it gets to an Italian sub shop that I've found in SF (so far). They have hot and cold sandwiches, burgers, and some dinner plates. They also do breakfast bagels. There is always a line around lunchtime, take that as a good sign. Check the daily special, too. You can't lose!
author: Halley S.

description:
I've had breakfast and lunch here now.  I have yet to try their burgers, but I've tried a couple of sandwiches and had their coffee.  Everything was A-OK, as 3 stars would suggest. The service seems quite friendly, so they get an additional star.  

There are a bunch of small tables that seat 2 or 4, and they have a TV over the entryway.  There are lots of folks here coming in to get sandwiches to-go around lunch time during the work week, but the line moves fast.  And if you want to take it easy and have a sit-down experience, it seems like there are always seats around.
author: Elaine S.

description:
They were almost out of the kind of bread I thought I wanted.  The sandwich maker offered to use the remaining piece for half of my sandwich, but it felt wrong to have one sandwich with two different kinds of bread, so I quickly chose a dark-brown bread.  When I finally got home and ate my sandwich, I was elated at my misfortune, which turned out to be fortunate.  I was in the right place at the right time, or the wrong place at the right time, or the right place at the wrong time.  Whatever, I scored the dark-brown bread.

Sorry, I really don't know what it's called.  I think I've had something like it before, but it's probably been years and maybe even decades.

Pete's is a real deli.  It's legit.  I've only had two different sandwiches from here, and the eggplant sandwich can be kind of a mess, but it's all worth it.  The people who work here are efficient and nice.  It's technically within walking distance of my flat, but all the times I've come here it's been because I decided to get lost on the bus.

So get lost on the bus and try Pete's!  Or if you're in the neighborhood for some scary medical procedure like I've been before, try Pete's!  Or if you like to eat a lot and you just finished a burrito at El Burrito Express 2 and are still hungry for a delicious sandwich on dark-brown bread, try Pete's!
author: John S.

description: Had time to kill, going to UCSF Medical Center, the Reuben sandwich and a cheeseburger both were very good.  Bring cash no credit card
author: S S.

description:
For sanfrancisco this is decidedly mediocre, at best.   Not horrible, definitely not horrible, but not that great either.  

I had a pesto chicken sandwhich.  
Pesto = good
CHeese = not bad
Bread = good
Chicken = Very thin breast, meat was at best 1/2 of what I'd expect in a $10 sandwhich, making this $6 sandwich well not particularly cheap.  

Overall taste was not the best.  Didn't feel the wholesome full feeling I get after a tasty deli sandwich, which was what I was looking for.

Overall . The place feels a little dirty.  They had a good selection of energy bars --- but a bunch I discovered were expired.  

Sandwiches are not bad, but not that great.  I would have gladly gone elsewhere had I known it wasn't a 4 star worthy.
author: Alex L.

description: Good rice krispy treat, ok prices, and friendly cashier!  And they didn't kick me out (before I gave them my business) when I was using their doorway as a way to shield myself from the cold gusts of air while waiting for MUNI.
author: Jane D.

description:
I always love stopping here when I work my occasional split shift. I usually have the same thing which is the chicken pesto sandwich. The entire menu is prepared fresh to order and there is a huge selection of food. 

Pete's has a rather large Mexican selection, numerous hot dishes to choose from, and there is always a handful of people eating one of the huge burgers. 
My favorite sandwich is the chicken pesto which is pretty awesome. The bread is perfectly toasted, slathered with pesto sauce and stacked with grilled chicken breast and melted cheese. It's a large sandwich and always leaves me stuffed. 

Pete himself is usually at the register ringing people up and is a really nice guy. The head cook (?manager) can be a bit short when the lines get long so make sure you know what you are going to order. 

Overall, A Great place to grab a sandwich, burger, or burrito if you are in the area. Prices are fair (CASH ONLY) and the food is always fresh.
author: Matt J.

description: Cash only with an ATM outside. I got a good juicy cheeseburger, quickly and cheaply. The fries are mediocre but that didn't bother me. I came craving a cheeseburger and left happy!
author: Erin S.

description:
Dear Pete's,

You are there for me when I need a breakfast burrito before work on Friday after a happy hour gone wrong Thursday night... when I need a delicious deli turkey sandwich... simply a bag of chips and a soda... or maybe even Excedrin and a lottery ticket. 

You have everything I could ever need and more. What would I do without you?? I wish you weren't cash only... but I'm already over it because you are otherwise so accommodating.

Love, 

Molly
author: Molly S.

description: A neighborhood gem. I have come here for years. Since the '90s. It is a real neighborhood diner, all fresh, all cooked in house, no pretense-- getting few and far between with the gentrification of the city. Made to order sandwiches with lots of choices for fillings and breads -- including Cubano sandwich, breakfast all day, different cheese steaks (from steak prepared and cooked in house), fish/shrimp and chips. My favorite is the egg salad on ciabatta. ($5.99 on a 6 inch) Still the best I've had outside my home. Very reasonable prices and generous portions. Fresh fruit and fruit salad made in house. Always a hot entry available ie roast chicken, mashed potatoes, broccoli. Made in house, very fresh, changed daily. And whole roasted turkey for sandwiches or a hot meal. Customers I've seen include the whole range of ucsf med staff as well as construction workers and office workers. Hope this gem has many more years despite the change in city demographics. The place down the block on the corner with Post certainly went commercial and upmarket with the change from the longtime owners.
author: Patricia L.

description:
"Another beautiful day."

Statement from the gentleman behind the counter (perhaps Pete himself).

True story. Very nice out. Almost Indian summer.

Did his good mood combined with the nice day have something to do with why my waffles topped with assorted fruit tasted so good?

Perhaps not. But it certainly didn't hurt.

Great waffle. Great staff. Great day.
author: Jason B.

description:
Best deli in the area
This is an old skool SF deli serving the neighborhood lunch crowd.  It offers a wide menu of hot and cold breakfast and lunch items.  There's also daily specials of roast turkey, meatloaf and other hot plates.  The breakfast is your basic egg combos and sandwiches, also breakfast burritos.
The lunch offers some mexican food, burgers, hot and cold sandwiches, salads and soups.  Every item is always hot and fresh and tastes great!  The sandwiches are stacked with meats and the salads are a filling meal in a bowl.
The staff likes to keep it moving due to the long lines during lunch hour so be ready to order when it's your turn.  
The house special is the "Sleeping Pill", a double-patty burger on a roll with all the fixins.  If you finish it all, you'll definitely be seeing stars!
Good food but street parking can be tough.
author: Pablo R.

description: I used to go when my dad was at the UCSF...I love that place. I love the french toast with bacon, and for lunch I loved their Tuna sandwich and french fries on the side.
author: Rocio G.

description:
A bit over priced along with thoughtful thoughtlessness. 
What do I mean by that? 

Well, my daughter and I came in for a breakfast bite. She had the short stack for $6.00, and I had a $7.00 omelette. Cash only, dine in. 

She had to "use it" and was so politely denied access as she stood there doing a potty-dance. I had already paid and we were about to die of starvation so we ran out into the rain in search of a toilet. 

When we came back, they delivered the food. You can't really mess up pancakes-They were rubbery. My omelette was bland, the toast over-done on one side untoasted on the other- but staff was friendly, even when they deny a desparate six year old the use of their toilet.

If you offer dine-in, the least you could do is have a restroom for you customers!
author: Cyn B.

description: This place was delicious and ran by locals. I was very impressed with how fresh the food was and how well kept the establishment was. The service was great and the atmosphere was perfect. The prices are very reasonable in comparison to the rest of the city and I will definitely be going back when I am in the area.
author: BoGordon F.

description: Super clean, friendly, fast, inexpensive, and most importantly absolutely delicious!!!
author: Jes A.

description:
Every time I stop by here, I leave extremely happy.

The staff is very friendly, and make some great food. Every meal I've had tasted better than the one before. Try the cheese steaks for a wonderful lunch, or the chorizo breakfast burrito for a hearty breakfast.

The prices aren't the best but comparable to nearby establishments, and totally worth it. They only accept cash so remember to stop by the ATM located next door.
author: Justin C.

description: Overpriced and shitty quality.  Why is food in this area so bad?? This is the last time I spend a dime at Pete's $12.00 for dry sausage, scrambled eggs and raw potatoes.
author: EC N.

description: Food gets a 7//10 but what makes this place great is the atmosphere. The guys are really nice and the prices are very reasonable. Cash only, ATM is outside.
author: Danny K.

description:
Needed lunch while waiting for my wife at an appt. looked for a sandwich place with good rating that was nearby. Walked in and ordered. Not til after I ordered and walked to the register did I see a tiny wrinkled sign that said CASH ONLY. Really?! 

Ordered the pastrami avocado and Swiss on sliced sourdough. Bread was stale, meat was out of a wrapper. I would not recommend to anyone.
author: Geoff R.

description:
Sorry, Pete, I wanted to like you but it was far too expensive for the quality of food I got. 

I get breakfast on the go all the time and the breakfast burrito I got was too cheesy and just not tasty. I've had plenty of breakfast burritos in my day and this one was just subpar. I should have listened to my Kaiser doctor when he told me to stay away from this place. 

I may try it again to see if it redeems itself given all the other positive yelp reviews, but for now it's just an average 3.
author: Carlos A.

description: I always forget that their "CASH ONLY"!!!! I wish they would change that some day because the ATM next to the Deli doesn't work half the time.... Like today....  :-/. BUT the food is GOOD!!!! That's why I just walked in forgetting about their cash only policy....
author: Mia B.

description:
I've worked next to Pete's for 9 years, what I love about this place is it's totally consistent and delish!  I've had everything from their pancakes in the morning, to the veggie sandwich and a bacon, bleu cheese burger and BBQ ribs.

The food preparation is great quality and consistent no matter how busy they get and during lunch they get really slammed.

Their ingredients are fresh, well put together and the guys who work there are GREAT.  The prices are comparable to what you find at any decent deli, but it isn't "cheap eats" that's for sure.
author: Joaquin C.

description: I was very surprised by this place. Went to the hospital with my grandmother accross the street for some labs and testing and had to wait an hour for results. We were hungry and a lady suggested this place. I was a bit skeptical, but it was really GOOD!!!. Burgers were fresh and tasty. Best part, is that my grandmother now can't stop talking about this place and wants to go back!!!
author: Serina H.

description:
I went here for an omelette this morning (bacon, jalapenos, & jack cheese), pretty good stuff.  The toast was just right in my opinion, though I think they go a little overboard with the onions in the potato hash, but that's merely a matter of taste.  I was served very quickly.

This is pretty much my place to go to if I have time to kill before or after a medical appointment, though street parking is real hard to come by.  The nearby lot charges $2 for each 20 minutes.

They're sandwiches, if I recall correctly, are really excellent.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
great little (it's actually pretty big) shop for a sandwich, drink, or other quick meal. I've had the breakfast here, which is pretty decent, sandwiches are quite lovely and service is spectacular.

if you want something quick, decent, and cheap, roll to pete's.
author: Victor B.

description: I tried there philly cheese steak its was pretty good had alot of meat an cheese and grilled onions yum yum
author: Rene L.

description:
This is a review for their Avocado Sandwich and Falafel Sandwich:


This is one of the first places I ate when I first began my job at UCSF, and I have been going back periodically since.

The Deli is humongous and has a wide variety of sandwiches to choose from. Want chicken on your sandwich? BAM! Vegetarian? BAM! Huge 14 inch sandwich subs? BAM!

Let's kick it up a notch.

This place gets crowded during lunch time and you can usually see 4-5 cooks doing their thing behind the counter. Just peering over it, you can tell that all of their ingredients are fresh, and you can sometimes see one or two of them preparing food for use later in the day.


The downsides to this place are:

     Close at 5pm
     Cash only
     I've had better falafel and avocado sandwiches. 

The falafel here is tougher and the outside of it is harder than expected. You can get better falafel at King Falafel down the street, and for less too.

The avocado sandwich, if you get it with their standard 14+ inch bread, is pretty much just bread. Envision a 4 inch diameter sandwich with a slap of avocado on the inside.


However, when I have the cash on me and I'm looking for something good to eat, I will usually come here to sit down and have a nice lunch.
author: Shaun D.

description:
Pete's deli is the shit!!!

Went there yesterdayand tried the salame sandwich on dutch crunch. staff is always so nice and accomodating, reasonably priced, wish it wasn't cash-only but it's worth it.! Will be back for sure
author: Harvey C.

description:
After spending hours at the hospital with my husband, I wandered out into the neighborhood to buy us both some lunch (eat at the hospital? don't go there.) This place had a big menu taped to the front window, they had stuff my husband would like, so I went in. 

I felt like I had been transported to Schenectady 1975, when the old GE plant was in full swing.  This felt like one of those places that caters to working people - people who work hard for not too much money and only get 30 minutes for lunch.  I was right.

The decor is utilitarian. The service is fast, friendly and accomplished. The food was great - fresh and made-to-order.  I got back to the hospital and gave my husband his (non-styrofoam) box . . . he took one bite of his sandwich and said, with a smile, "where did you find this?"

Highly recommended if you're stuck at Kaiser or Mt. Zion for any reason.
author: Anna L. C.

description:
If you're hungry but just can't decide what to eat, then I recommend checking out Pete's. 
They've got a huge menu with everything from salads to burgers to turkey dinners. And their philly cheesesteaks are way better than the couple shops in the area that focus solely on that delicious dish. 
Pete's is right across the street from the hospital on divis, so it gets pretty busy with doctors and nurses around lunch time, but even then its a pretty short wait, and once you get you're food, you'll be happy you stuck around.
author: Ryan M.

description:
The cheese steak here is consistently amazing.  The meat's greasy delicious-- but not too sloppy. The bun is toasted to perfection, and yet still fluffy.

Pete also offers big tasty burgers, and damn good deli sandwiches.  And, it's all cheap as hell.

Damn good job, guys.
author: L J.

description: This place is a gem in my neighborhood. The owners are very friendly and do a great job running the place. They have THE BEST breakfast burritos in the city. Not too big, not too small with potatoes, eggs, cheese, and your choice of bacon, steak, or chorizo. I get it with chorizo every time. Ask for spicy and special too! Made to perfection every time. Another favorite of mine is their breakfast sandwich. Get it with bacon on an english muffin. I'm not normally a fan of american cheese, but in this sandwich, it has the perfect melted consistency and brings the b-fast sandwich together. I sometimes go here for lunch too. The tuna melt is made the right way by frying the tuna on the grill before sandwiching it between the bread and cheese. Also, their Reuben is delicious. They don't overstuff it, so it doesn't fall apart while you eat it. Perfect proportions of pastrami, sauerkraut, and thousand island. So good. Remember to bring cash since they don't accept card. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. My favorite place for a quick breakfast! :D
author: Gina I.

description: Just ate there for lunch, I must say it sucked. We ordered sandwiches and I'm pretty sure the guy who took our order was high. Then he didn't listen when I said what I wanted on the sandwich. He asked me what I wanted, I said no pickles but he misunderstood me and when I tried to correct him he pretty much ignored me and just printed the ticket. I had to correct part of my order with the cashier... The ingredients were not very good, the bread was dry and they didn't really "build" it very good so it was a little challenging to eat. there are too many awesome places in the city to eat. i wouldn't waste $10 again...
author: amy m.

description:
How is it possible that I have not yet written a review of this place?  It has been a staple in my work week diet for years!  Pete, the owner, is a sweet man and always has a smile for everyone, even if you're not a regular. 

Favorite items are the Chicken Pesto sandwich and the Chicken Caesar salad.  My advice is to go before the lunch rush hits or call in your order for pick up. Otherwise you could find yourself in a very long line!  Speaking of which, my order is probably ready...
author: LeSLiE W.

description: Love this place. Sandwich ingredients are always fresh and their daily specials are delicious. Try the smoked turkey with cranberry sauce, mmmm.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Ahhh Pete's - you're my favorite neighborhood deli. And not only are you a deli, you guys also have some really great breakfast options. Love the breakfast sandwiches ($3.99) and your regular plates of egg, toast and bacon/sausage. Good, fast, friendly and cheap.

Lunch options - they've got something for everyone. Sandwiches, burritos, burgers, etc etc. And yes, they have Dutch Crunch bread :)

It's easy to miss in a somewhat sleepy part of Divis but it really is a gem. CASH ONLY and closed on Sundays.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: The best breakfast burrito anywhere and chef Jose's fresh salsa verde made from roasted jalapeño is amazing!!!
author: Brian A.

description: Quick and easy...breakfast burritos made to order and fresh coffee...all the ingredients for a high potential day.
author: Jeff C.

description:
My husband had a dr appt nearby and I was gettin hungry so I got on yelp to find a nearby place to eat and came across this place. We walked on over there and ordered some cheesesteak sandwiches. 
I got the bacon cheesesteak and my husband got the bbq cheesesteak and some fries. 
MMMMmmm were they good. And good price too! SOOOO much better than that shitty place called the cheesteak shop!

I was suprised on all the sandwich/lunch/food selections they had. I thought it was just gonna be a small cold deli. 

Id def. go here again.

Sucky thing is, they only accept cash. 
I would have thought theyd take card as it seems to be in a busy businessy area.
author: Viv D.

description:
I always get their grilled chicken ceasar salad. Lots of warm grilled chicken (that's NOT dry) and deliciously buttered garlic bread. The first time I ordered the salad the garlic bread was a win because it was a unexpected addition to my salad. Come to think of it, I actually like the garlic bread more than the salad...

Not a fan of the breakfast burrito because when you get down to the last bite it's just oil and grease...No bueno.

Fast and nice service. Cash only. They have an atm outside and a Wells Fargo atm is just down the block. Best for lunch but watch out for the long lines. Everyone from UCSF comes to eat here.
author: Tina Y.

description:
if you can find parking you're lucky because its tough out here with the hospital nearby.

so many sandwiches to choose from.  even hamburgers.

decent price and you can choose between larger and smaller sandwiches.  you can get any kind of meat, on any kind of bread.  same with the hamburgers, but normally you take the bun...i always ask for a french roll for my hamburgers.

they also do philly cheesesteaks...i don't know if i'll try it, i see another place that i like to go to.  It would be hard for me to order that here but they have it if you're interested.
author: Bing D.

description:
Eclectic. Amusing. Joe-schmo.

A great place to go after unofficially being semi-diagnosed with acute gastritis!  

Couldn't tell you what prompted me to walk in, but the doctor prescribed the BRAT diet and what better place to go than Pete's?  The apple was an apple! The toast was toast!  It was great.  

The people that work here are very friendly in a very keep-it-real sort of way and the seating is abundant since not many people actually go here to eat.  
On a later trip, my monthly grilled cheese was overly greasy.  My gf's turkey and avoc sandwich was hum-drum but not terrible.

Pete's offers: bagels, pancakes, scrambled or fried eggs, coffee, quesadillas, sandwiches, fruit, baklava, mashed potatoes, roasted turkey, candy, boiled eggs.....yes, an indecisive foodie's hell.

Know Before You Go:
1. Good for quick eats, but not the best quality.
2. Ample seating inside.
author: Jane L.

description:
Oh my goodness. That was the most offensively greasy hamburger (the "Pete's Special": a not-even-remotely-lean beef patty with huge half-cooked strips of bacon, swiss cheese, avocado, served on a sourdough roll) and heap of fries I've ever consumed in my entire life. But it was also pretty damn tasty, and reasonably priced. And the service is very friendly here, too.

After wolfing down something so literally drenched and dripping with melted animal fat and cheese, I'm now seriously considering going vegan. (but probably won't)

A harrowing yet delicious dining experience. Thinking maybe I'll just get a regular sandwich next time.
author: Brendan R.

description:
I'm so surprised that I haven't written a review for this awesome deli cafe right across from where I work and I come here every week!

They have everything from sandwiches, breakfast (omelette's, pancakes, bagels, breakfast sandwiches, and baked items), cheese-steak, burritos, quesadilla, salads, burgers, veggie items, etc. EVERYTHING!

I love coming here for lunch and sometimes grab food for dinner or the next day if it's a Sunday. 
I like their:
Chicken Cesar Salad (around $7)- BIG salad, plenty of grilled chicken, Parmesan cheese, and 3 huge slices of yummy buttery garlic bread, the reason why I get this salad is for the garlic bread! If you want croutons in your salad, make sure to let them know because they never put it on unless you tell them to.
Turkey avocado and Swiss sandwich ($6.45)- Very good deal for a sandwich, they give you plenty of meat on any type of bread you like (if you want choices, gotta go early, they run out fast!) and fresh avocado but sometimes they put guacamole instead?
"The Sub" ($6.99)- Comes with Turkey, pastrami, ham, and cheese. My second favorite when I'm craving all meat!
Breakfast sandwich's like the Turkey, egg, cheese, on onion bagel is so good around $4, you get a lot!

They are always busy, especially during lunch time, there could be a line out the door.  Service is always friendly and fast. Remember to get that frequent card, they tend to not give you one if you don't have one already...... Friday's are double stamp day!

CASH ONLY!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Juliane N.

description:
The sign in the window and the employees t-shirts remind you at every opportunity that Pete's Deli has been in business since 1969. As far as I can tell, this is the secret to staying in business for 28 years in this neighborhood:

1. Make good sandwiches. People like sandwiches that taste good. If nothing else make a tasty turkey & cranberry sauce on a hard roll, but if you can manage that your other sandwiches will probably be good too.
2. Open across the street from hospitals and doctors offices. People in healthcare are busy and like to be able to walk across the street and get a tasty sandwich.
3. Have your sandwich people work fast. Busy people like doctors and nurses like it when they don't have to wait 30 minutes to get some meat and produce put between slices of bread. 
5. You don't have to be open late or on weekends; The doctors offices aren't open so you probably won't do enough business to cover the payroll and utilities. There may be some people in the neighborhood who want sandwiches on saturdays every now and then but screw them.

Now tell me this isn't a useful review; It's like a damn Wharton MBA in 2 paragraphs.
author: matthew r.

description:
A little early for an 8AM meeting, running across the street from the Southeast corner of Sutter/ Divisadero... Must... get.... coffee.... 

My choices: 
1. This cute little spot on the corner 
or 
2. A block away, the Ominous Green Awning of *bucks. 

I figured, ok, so, I should support the local businessowner, I'll have my coffee with two Splendas and nonfat milk at this little spot, instead. 

I ordered my coffee, $1.50 later they hand me a cup, which i promptly fill with the medium roast blend.... 
Looking at the condiments, I don't see any yellow or blue packets. 
Upon further inquiry, to my horror... "We don't got any of that". 

What the......? 

Defeated, and since I don't have it in me to 'return' my coffee since they have neither splenda nor equal nor nonfat milk: 
I drank my coffee with Sweet n Low and half and half. 

Worse things have happened on a Monday morning... but *no* Splenda? *no* Equal? Common guys....
author: M'ia K.

description:
This place was hopping with local workers when I stopped in for lunch today.  My roomie tried it once and said it was really good, but as they're really only open during the day, I haven't had the pleasure before.
I'll try it again, but my muffaletta was kinda icky.  The staff was friendly, but the competing lines resulted in a bit of a cluster with people waiting in the wrong spot and then getting angry that they had been waiting and weren't next. . . you know how it is.  Head all the way toward the drink fridges to order your food, then along the counter to the cash register to pay.  Cash only!  Luckily there is an ATM right outside (on Sutter between the deli and the parking garage) if you're caught unprepared.
My sandwich ($6.99), plus two small bags of chips and soda = almost $12 for lunch.  Kinda pricey.  But isn't everything now?
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Coffee is not so good.... but you can tell it doesn't matter.  These people service the proleteriat.  The populists... the working man!  a quick and easy hardboiled egg, water, banana... no problem.  A cup of coffee, a bagel sandwich, and an omelette?  Give em 3 minutes!

They are a great place that gets you fed, cheap and fast.  This isn't high end, fine dining.... but for what it does and how it does it it is top notch.

A local institution, it is an awesome place to rest while you have a moment and watch the community operate and thrive around you.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Every sandwich I've had here is fantastic. Lately I've been on a chicken caesar salad kick and I never get tired of Pete's. That might have something to do with the cute guy who works here who remembers me and my order every time I go in. He gives me a big smile and proudly says, "Chicken caesar salad right? I remember!". Even if I'm sort of in the mood for a turkey sandwich, how can I argue with a cute deli guy who always remembers me? FYI - the garlic bread that comes with the salad has some serious garlic action that will stay with you for the rest of the day. Really good while you're eating lunch. Not so good if you have to go back to work and talk to people after lunch.

Some other things I love about Pete's: The old Tab Cola/Champagne sign out front... it cracks me up every time I see it. I hope Pete keeps it up there forever. And their frequent eater stamp card makes me feel like I'm accomplishing something worthwhile with my life.
author: Brandy H.

description:
Double stamp Fridays?!?!  How did I not know this was around? 12 stamps and Pete's will buy your next meal!!!  Nice...

Cheeseburger is great, fries excellent.  They have a wide variety of foodies and my co-workers swear by their sandwiches.  Word on the street, the turkey is the bomb and if you're not there by a certain time it is scraped clean to the bone.  To the bone...

Lots of UCSF'ers at Mt. Zion come here 'cuz it's across the street, this place is always busy but worth the wait!!!
author: Jenn A.

description:
Damned hungry. "Can I get the burger?" "Sure!"

10 minutes later, I get smacked in the face with taste. Surprised, I looked around. I saw a picture of Pete by the door. His smile assured me that his spirit lived. I ate that burger with a tear in my eye. I had fallen in love with Pete's Deli & Cafe.
author: Haz O.

description:
Sure, it's divey. Sure, the food is OK. But go a few times, and you'll be in love with Pete and his son Omar and the rest of the staff, just the way I am. The other day, a temp I hired to work across the street from the deli for 6 weeks went in there after a 4-year hiatus (he moved away from the city). Pete and Omar remembered his name, everything.

Seriously, this is one of those places that when you know about it, gives San Francisco it's charm.
author: Cate F.

description:
The staff are cool, but the food is mediocre.
I had the BLT sandwich a few days ago, and it was more like an "ehhh" type of taste from the amount of money I paid for. 

I might go back, but only on Fridays for the two-stamp thing.
author: R T.

description: What a disappointment!  Really bland sandwiches. I got the chicken pesto - one super thin chicken breast with limited veggies and no-taste pesto sauce. The pork loin sandwich my husband got was better but not by much. Will my come back here.
author: Melanie W.

description:
Turkey Avocado Swiss on dutch crunch... ALWAYS.
I've made this order at least 5 times for lunch/dinner -- consistently PERFECT. Lots of meat, avocado spread is awesome. The hubby doesn't like avocado, but on these sandwiches-- he'd finish everything every time!

Will be ordering another for dinner tonite.
author: Faye H.

description:
the guy who works the register is so chill and nice, so i gotta give a star just for him. as for the food, i still have yet to decide. i got a grilled ham and cheese and was so disgusted at the greasiness that i couldnt even eat half. i tried a turkey burger and that was MUCH better. well-made and a HUGE patty! im curious to try their other sandwiches, like the thanksgiving one with turkey and cranberry sauce. for now, though, this place is just my go-to for a random snack if im hungry walking to the bus. overpriced and random assortment of snacks, but there's a variety nonetheless. lots of luna bar and cliff bar flavors to choose from :)

heads up: CASH ONLY - there's an ATM outside but you have to pay a fee to use it
author: Stephanie C.

description:
For what it is, not bad. I'm on the fence about the heads-up cheesesteak-off against the "Caution: May Be Habit-Forming" place across the street. I ordered a cheesesteak with mushrooms from both places:

* Pete's: faster, cheesier, gooeyer, mushroom-y, meat was good
* CMBHF: slow (!!), no cheese, two pieces of mushroom, meat was great.

I'll have to try them both again.

Pete's also makes a good burger.
author: Rob T.

description: I'm sorry that I have to hate on this place, cause the people are all friendly. I've been to Pete's on a handful of occasions for lunch and I have to say that I've never been impressed with the quality of the food. The sandwiches are about as plain as one could imagine, a paltry amount of meat served with soggy lettuce and tomato. Ordering avocado on your sandwich gets you a slather of weird, bland avocado spread, not sliced avocado. The meatball sub was passable, but not good enough to make up for all the other sub-par things I've gotten there. Also, their damn tv is always on and blaring some ridiculously obnoxious infomercial. It has made for some unenjoyable lunch breaks. If you're in a hurry and need to grab something fast, then Pete's is a decent option, but if you're in the area and looking for a great lunch, I would definitely head elsewhere.
author: Peter S.

description: place is good for a quick bite to eat (especially their sandwiches). service can be a bit slow at peak hours (around noon) with long lines but worth the wait. store is a bit cramped but nothing unusual in san francisco. big fan for lunch.
author: Anish P.

description: One of my favorite breakfast/lunch stops on workdays.  Quick breakfasts. Great sandwiches, fast service.  Skip the lasagna and go for the turkey.  Burgers are good too!
author: Christopher M.

description: Free delivery (over 10 bucks), delicious sandwiches and burgers, and they are not afraid to make a crispy fry..
author: Shawna D.

description: I just moved into the hood for the summer and have been dabbling in the local fare.  There are a few cheese steak places in the general vicinity, including one right  across the street from Pete's.  And while Pete's isn't just a cheese steak place, they do make a killer one, way better than across the street.  Better meat, veggies, cheese, and much better bun.  Also tried the Reuben which was very good, though not as big a portion as the cheese steak.  The meatball sub was solid as well.  Also they have different hot food daily and the carnitas dinner looked awesome, though I didn't get to try it.  The dudes who work there are fun as well.  4 stars, not 5 cause I got a veggie sandwich once and it was pretty weak and the bread on that sandwich was stale.
author: Sam C.

description: The food is great. I love the chicken pesto sandwich, the terriyake chicken sandwich and the breakfast sandwich is a good bargain. I love Havier who works at the front. They have the best coffee in the vacinity much better than Starbucks. The only downside is they dont accept ATM, cash only. The price is a tad bit high buit the food is filling. If you dont mind spending around 8-9 buck for just a sandwich(not including a drink) than you'll love this place.
author: chari b.

description: Great selection of food (burgers, breakfast items, fresh made sandwiches, tacos) and drinks.  I met Pete a couple of months ago and he was super friendly and helpful.  Great place to stop by and get a snack if you're in the area.
author: Maxine S.

description: I was across the street at UCSF-Mt. Zion while my aunt was getting tests done when I got hungry and decided to walk over here. Place looked busy enough that I thought it must be ok. Man was I wrong, it's great. I got the Chicken Caesar salad and it was awesome, tons of chicken for sure. But the best part was the bread. Wow is all I can say. It was just amazing. I will definitely come back next time I'm in the area. It may get a 5th star once I have tried more of the menu. I think the Chicken Pesto is next on my list...
author: Jonah S.

description: This Deli place is right by my work.  This place is pretty good.  I have only had the turkey sandwiches and the Mediterranean plate.  The turkey sandwiches have always been fresh and delicious.  One day I was feeling healthy so I ordered the Mediterranean plate not really sure what to expect but I thought I would try it.  I was surprised at how yummy and fresh the food was.  My only complaint is that given 1 whole pita bread is simply not enough for all the hummus they served.  Another general compliant is that they are cash only.  Really?!  I hate when places do cash only.  They have a lot of business and they can use Square if they are concerned about the cost of using credit cards.  There is an ATM located right outside of their establishment.  I always judge places that have ATMs located either inside or right outside their establishment.  Are they making money off of this? If they took card, I would give them a 4, but for the inconvenience I am giving them 3 stars.
author: Vagabond V.

description: I did not actually eat the mashed potatoes there. But my wife and her friend did. Here is what my wife said: "Jill and I declared them garlicky, fatty, cold, slimy, and lumpy. Other than that, they were fine. Congealed pig mucous or wallpaper paste. Tough call." Just thought you should know, even though I did not eat them, about the mashed potatoes. Life is short.
author: Robert C.

description: omg!!! i am soooo in love with this  place.. my s/o and i make special trips just for the 12" bacon philly cheesesteak .. oh wow!! the food is made fresh, staff is amazing.. they have sooo many food options for just about anyone.. they have a customer for life over here!!!
author: Summer V.

description: I like this place for grab and go breakfasts in the morning.  Four stars for their fast and friendly service, awesome donuts, and convenient location (for me anyway).  Does anyone know where they get their donuts from?  They're insanely fluffy!
author: Krystle S.

description:
if you like prison food made as quickly as possible w/ the least amount of ingredients by rude people, this place is for you - I'll pass!

I don't know what's more disgusting?
The gross, greasy, watery sandwich I just tried to choke down -
or that I just spent $15 there?

I give this place one finger up!
author: Barney M.

description:
It's like somebody uprooted a shoddy Long Island deli & placed it across from a hospital in the heart of San Francisco. I stopped in to pick up a cup of weak & not very tasty coffee this morning, but I was taken by the fact that the nurse on line in front of me was talking to the register man about some medicine another co-worker had been prescribed.

"Is that hair stuff working for [I forget the dude's name]?"
"Yeah, it's working good."
"Good!"

I'm pretty sure everyone there is a regular from the UCSF medical center across the street, & that's probably a convenience thing more than anything, but still, they were friendly & the place was down home. I liked something about the blue collar ambiance.

**UPDATE** had another cup of coffee there the other morning & it was WORSE. Minus one star. Sorry Pete's, you may have my namesake, but your coffee is pretty terrible.
author: Pete J.

description: We stumbled on this place by chance between appointments at UCSF Med Center and were pleasantly surprised. The philly cheese steak sandwich was good and served on a perfectly toasted roll. The breakfast burrito was pretty good too. They have an extensive menu with everything from burgers, hot and cold sandwiches, salads, Mexican food, and more, which isn't readily visible from the outside. My only complaint is that the philly wasn't meaty enough for my tastes. I got there before the lunch rush and saw the baked chicken and rice pilaf which looked delicious. The staff is friendly and outgoing and was busting my chops for daring to wear an Oakland A's shirt in Giants territory as if they knew me (I didn't mind). Overall, I'll go back next time I'm in the area.
author: Miguel R.

description: Pete's!  Delicious, delicious sandwiches!  Seriously, this is one gas-station-like-deli that knows how to do the sandwich right!  Ok, so it's not a gas station, but it definitely has a weird industrial/ hospital feel to it (probably becuase of its proximity to Kaiser).  The only draw back of perfect Pete's are the business hours.  It is one of those places that is only open until 3pm and closed on Sundays.  Sadly, I wake up many a Sunday morning craving that perfect combo of crunch and substance that one can only find in a hand crafted sandwich.  I highly, HIGHLY recommend this delicious deli.  Don't be put off by its appearance, you'll definitely fall in love with the food.
author: Jill W.

description: I heart Pete's.  When I used to work at Mt. Zion and I was a regular at this spot.  The owner is so friendly and sweet and has been there before I was born.  I haven't had anything here that I didn't like.  My faves are the turkey burgers and the grilled chicken/pesto sandwich. Oh soooo good!  Reasonable, quick and super friendly service.  A for sure spot for lunch in you are ever in the area!
author: Mijiza M. S.

description: Divey?  The Lusty Lady is divey.  Jonell's is divey.  Pete's is not divey.  Is it divey because the guys wear t-shirts? Is it because they make really divey, low-class statements such as, "Good afternoon, Buddy" and "Great to see you!" ??? I don't get it.  Maybe it's divey by Pacific Heights standards.  All I know is it kicks the ass off that cheese steak place down the block AND it completely dominates that horrid, pukey, waspy-as-fuck, "Mexican" restaurant nearby.   I always get the Putanesca sandwich.  It's amazing!  The only meatless sandwich upon which I'd bestow a top rating.   You might also want to check out the falafel place a block up.  Another plebian treasure!
author: J P.

description: I haven't been a regular patron of this deli, but I do visit on occasion.  I work at one of the hospitals nearby so the location is convenient.  I tried the mushroom cheese steak before and it is absolutely the best damn cheesesteak i have tasted.  Way Way better then the Cheese steak shop across the street.  I got the 10in and it was enought food for 2 hungry people.  they pile on the meat and cheese and it is oh so tasty.  The price may seem a little high, but it is well worth it.   Matter of fact, I'm gonna get me one in about 15 minutes on my lunch break.   I haven't tried anything else, they do have an extensive menu and the hot food looks really good.  Only draw back is the huge line that can go out the door at times, Some advice, CALL AHEAD!!
author: Pedro N.

description: their cheesesteak sandwich is off the hook. not the best looking spot but sandwiches are great
author: jeff s.

description: Pete's is kind of a divey-deli but they have really  good, tasty cheese steaks.  Their breakfasts are large but nothing to write home about .  Go there for the cheese steak (!) during lunchtime and say hi to Pete- he's been there since 69 or something.  He's one percent guido-ish but 99% cool old guy.
author: yvette l.

description:
Yesterday was the first time I went to Pete's Deli and I loved it!  When we were looking for a place to eat, the surgical staff recommended Pete's.  Even though we were a bit anxious about my husbands surgery down the street, we felt comfortable, welcomed and appreciated as soon as we walked in the Deli.  Pete had just made the hummas and encouraged me to try it which I did.  We had the turkey burger, chicken pesto sandwich and the falafel sandwich.  They even warmed up the pita bread to go with the hummas.  Everything was great.  I didn't notice any cracked wheat in the tabouli so the majority of it was vegetables.  I knew everything was very fresh so it was really flavorful.  I enjoyed the coffee (I had the medium roast).  It wasn't bitter but still had a nice flavor.
The cafe was busy (about 1:30) but we were served quickly and the food looked good.
If I'm in that part of the city, I'll be sure to stop by again.
author: Diane G.

description:
After having Pete's Deli & Cafe for lunch today, it made me wonder, "Why this  is only my second time going to Pete's, when I've been in the neighborhood for 2 1/2 years."  I guess the answer is that Pete's is a block further than King of Falafel, which is often my go to spot if I feel like a quick meal.  King of Falafel happened to be closed today and so I was left wandering aimlessly looking for a meal and ended up at Pete's Deli & Cafe.

The first time I went to Pete's I tried the Reuben sandwich, and it was delicious.  This time around though I was looking for a healthy alternative that ideally didn't involve buckwheat, kale, or almond butter.  On a side note, sorry Cafe Gratitude if I just inadvertently put down your entire menu.  Pete's offered a grilled lemon chicken sandwich that I figured wouldn't be nearly as good as the Reuben but at least it would be healthy and didn't involve getting into the flax seed revolution.  I was expecting a simple chicken sandwich but was pleasantly surprised at how good the lemon chicken sandwich was at Pete's Deli & Cafe.   I ordered the sandwich without mayonnaise and it isn't necessary since the lemon gave the chicken a nice added flavorful.  It was a delicious thin piece of chicken spread out on a sourdough roll.  I was expecting some cheapo roll, maybe Safeway brand or something, but the roll at Pete's was really good.

The combo of the roll, lemon flavoring, and quality chicken made me a fan of the sandwich and at $5.99, I might just order it again next December 27th if King of Falafel is closed.
author: Josh K.

description: Popped in here for a quick breakfast while the girlfriend went under the knife (she's fine, thank you). The place is nothing fancy--your typical deli/greasy-ish spoon. Clean though. I had a totally edible eggs with bacon. The potatoes were a little too close to the pre-frozen variety, but all-in-all it was a decent meal. Not a destination meal, to be sure, but it certainly did the trick for the time and place.
author: Chris O.

description: I wish there where no stars as a vote.  Wow one of the worst meals I tried to eat ever.  I had to throw it out. Gross gross gross.  Hey owner go eat at Art's Cafe on 9th ave if you want to see how a real meal is made.  Plus I got something so simple my 7 year old niece makes it at home.  A BLT, well mine came with NO Tomato????  UMMMMM that's not a BLT that's a BL. The bread was soggy the lettuce wilted and I got someone else's grilled cheese which was also not edible. Going on 40 years in business.  Be thanking your god everyday, because it is not your food or your service, or your prices that has kept you in business it is the old 3 most important things to a restaurant>>> Location Location Location.  If you moved 2 blocks out you would be out of business in 1 year.  SF is known all over the world for it's food......Please don't let this be an example of it
author: Jennifer S.

description: i'm still not sure how i feel about pete's.  been here twice now.  the first time, i had the pete's burger which was *nasty* (the bread was stale, the meat of poor quality, etc etc) and would've given the place only 2 stars.  the second time, however, i had an egg salad sandwich with avocado which, though nothing inspired, was cheap and quite decent.  i also got a peanut butter cookie both times i went and was happy with those :P.  i think i'll have to sample a few more menu items before actually settling in on my rating though.
author: Roshni R.

description: After hearing much about it from fellow co-workers I decided to give it a try. I went in there once to buy candy but didnt eat there because it just didnt look ummm friendly to eat at. Dont expect a nice place its really a mom and pop deli place/store. Anyways, I was not disappointed whatsoever. The sandwiches were made to order and they sell more then just sandwiches. It was really good, reasonably priced and service was cool. I defn eat there again. There was quite a variety that I had a hard time making a decision of what I wanted. They even sold beer there, hahaha. They only accept cash and line gets pretty long during lunch so try to avoid peak hours. Parking is hard in this area period.
author: J L.

description: most delicious breakfast burritos. only down side is that they close before i get home on the weekdays, and are open only one day on the weekends.
author: Eleanor M.

description: Thanks to the nearby medical buildings, this place gets PACKED at lunch time during the week.  And rightfully so.  The chicken pesto sandwich is excellent, as is the hot roast beef sandwich and their tuna salad.  The turkey sandwiches always seemed a bit bland, so I gave up on those, but most everything else is solid.  Despite the small size of the "kitchen" (you can hardly call it that), Pete's has a very comprehensive menu for both breakfast and lunch.  The only thing that's not very good there is the coffee, and the seating/atmoshpere is strictly functional - I usually get my grub to go.
author: Green T.
